EXEC.Session: Day 1, Session 3: Data as the Fuel: AI Data Strategy & Governance
Top_Motivations: It was interesting to learn about how to use the AI and that the data it gives ur is only data that we’ve trained it on, which is important to be vigilant of. Additionally it was interesting to learn about how data privacy is important when using chats as they are usually logged
Totally new information to me. Other sessions were interesting but not new.
In order to launch new ideas to vision, I takes strategy.

EXEC.Session: Day 3, Session1: Measuring AI Value: Beyond Traditional ROI & Ethical AI: Principles, Risks & Regulatory Compliance
Top_Motivations: The maturity framework, governance, and the considerations of deploying at scale were all very helpful.
Very useful information in this presentation, good to see industry use cases
Another good framework to assess where companies are in its AI joirney

EXEC.Session: Day 2, Session 3: Transforming Vision into Action Part 1: Business Impact Framework
Top_Motivations: Hard to choose just one - but I found the applied nature of this session very helpful (including spreadsheet tool)
My goals to grow my non-profit and launch other business ideas.
Very pragmatic framework that can be applied repeatedly

EXEC.Session: Day 3, Session 2: Navigating the AI Ecosystem: Build, Buy, or Partner

DEV.Session: Day 2, Session 3: Building RAG system with local LLM

Facilitator was great, enjoyed both sessions. I liked the hands on aspect and learning about implementing a local LLM was so cool.
Using LLM local was super practical and useful. A lot to learn.
